intro: Eutrema eschscholtzianum, commonly known as sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, lobed leaves and small yellow flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in salt marshes and dunes. Eutrema eschscholtzianum is adapted to saline environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
